text: As a summary, here's what I'm voting this year on my Edina, MN ballot (along with links to research on why I'm voting that way):For all partisan races (president, senate, house/state reps) - the DFL candidate.Statewide constitutional amendment - Yes.County Commissioner District 6 - Heather EdelsonMayor (Edina) - James B. HovlandCouncil Member (Edina) - Carolyn Jackson & James PierceChief Justice - Supreme Court - Natalie HudsonAssociate Justice - Supreme Court 6 - Karl ProcacciniJudge - Court of Appeals 12 - Diane BratvoldJudge - 4th District Court 24 - Matthew FrankAll other races are uncontested (but I fill in the bubbles anyways to avoid unexpected write-in winners)Many thanks to Naomi Kritzer for all her research (which, in turn, inspired these posts) and for giving out tips on how to research local political races.
html:
As a summary, here's what I'm voting this year on my Edina, MN ballot (along with links to research on why I'm voting that way):

  • For all partisan races (president, senate, house/state reps) - the DFL candidate.
  • Statewide constitutional amendment - Yes.
  • County Commissioner District 6 - Heather Edelson
  • Mayor (Edina) - James B. Hovland
  • Council Member (Edina) - Carolyn Jackson & James Pierce
  • Chief Justice - Supreme Court - Natalie Hudson
  • Associate Justice - Supreme Court 6 - Karl Procaccini
  • Judge - Court of Appeals 12 - Diane Bratvold
  • Judge - 4th District Court 24 - Matthew Frank
  • All other races are uncontested (but I fill in the bubbles anyways to avoid unexpected write-in winners)

Many thanks to Naomi Kritzer for all her research (which, in turn, inspired these posts) and for giving out tips on how to research local political races.
